doc:
Earl Dwire https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Earl_Dwire 0 Earl Dwire (October 3, 1883 – January 16, 1940) was an American character actor who appeared in more than 150 movies between 1921 and his death in 1940. Noted for his almost frightening long face, Dwire worked mainly as a villain in westerns, including Riders of Destiny (1933) with John Wayne in the first singing cowboy movie and The Trail Beyond (1934) opposite Wayne, Noah Beery, Sr., and Noah Beery, Jr. He also appeared in Bob Steele vehicles such as Alias John Law (1935). Earl_Dwire ( October_3_,_1883 – January_16_,_1940 ) was an_American_character_actor who appeared in more_than_150_movies between 1921 and his_death in 1940 . Noted for his_almost_frightening_long_face , Dwire worked mainly as a_villain in westerns , including Riders of Destiny_(_1933_) with John_Wayne in the_first_singing_cowboy_movie and The_Trail Beyond_(_1934_)_opposite_Wayne , Noah_Beery , Sr. , and Noah_Beery , Jr . He also appeared in Bob_Steele_vehicles such_as Alias_John_Law_(_1935_) .
